text:
I don't understand what's going on in my Documenter build, almost every example block errors with `MethodError: no method matching iterate(::Nothing)`<https://gitlab.com/JuliaGPU/AbstractPlotting-jl/-/jobs/912130931>

The return objects in these blocks are all new kinds of figure objects that I'm introducing in that PR, and granted a lot of them should error, but at least a couple shouldn't. I have only overloaded the `display` method for them, but I don't even understand where iteration is going on? I tested a very simple block and that worked fine for me locally..

Is Documenter doing something with my return values that they don't allow?

attachments.title: docs (#912130931) · Jobs · JuliaGPU / AbstractPlotting-jl
attachments.text: An abstract interface for plotting libraries, part of the Makie ecosystem.

method for them, but I don't even understand where iteration is going on? I tested a very simple block and that worked fine for me locally..

Is Documenter doing something with my return values that they don't allow?

text:
this is one example
```┌ Warning: failed to run `@example` block in src/plotting_functions.md:13-23
│ ```@example
│ using GLMakie
│ AbstractPlotting.inline!(true) # hide
│ 
│ xs = LinRange(1, 10, 20)
│ ys = LinRange(1, 15, 20)
│ us = [cos(x) for x in xs, y in ys]
│ vs = [sin(y) for x in xs, y in ys]
│ 
│ arrows(xs, ys, us, vs, arrowsize = 0.2, lengthscale = 0.3)
│ ```
│   c.value =
│    MethodError: no method matching iterate(::Nothing)
│    Closest candidates are:
│      iterate(!Matched::Core.SimpleVector) at essentials.jl:600
│      iterate(!Matched::Core.SimpleVector, !Matched::Any) at essentials.jl:600
│      iterate(!Matched::ExponentialBackOff) at error.jl:218
│      ...
└ @ Documenter.Expanders /builds/JuliaGPU/AbstractPlotting-jl/.julia/packages/Documenter/6vUwN/src/Expanders.jl:563```

text: `arrows` returns a `FigureAxisPlot` and `display` of that should redirect to display of the `scene` inside. With these `Scene` s as return values, the Documenter build worked fine before.

elements.text: of that should redirect to display of the
s as return values, the Documenter build worked fine before.

text: maybe you actually need to overload show?

elements.text: maybe you actually need to overload show?

text: display shouldn't be called that way when inlining
